title: Coffee for the Wolf
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2IK2WPc

by BenjiEmrys

Remus Lupin is neither a morning but nor a peoples’ person. So when he’s held up in a Starbucks line because some insolate bastard can’t find the right change, it’s safe to say he isn’t having a good day. Thank god Sirius knows all the right (worst) puns to cheer up the angst-fuelled college student.

summary: the boat that would row you back carefully
title: the boat that would row you back carefully
description:
by Anonymous

A boy he’d never seen before sat cross-legged in front of him. He had round spectacles which were broken in the center, and his pyjamas were odd and very bright-colored. They were also too big for him, which didn’t surprise Tom. Children were always wearing things which were too big or too small for them at Wool’s.

blog.name: bounding-heart
blog.title: Harry Potter Oriented Things
blog.description: Gryffindor, bi-sexual, old, feminist, over-emotional and unashamed, anti-antis. Love=J K Rowling, Cursed Child, Fantastic Beasts, Drarry, Hinny, Scorbus, Romione, Harry James Potter, Expect meta. Lots and lots of Harry Potter meta. It's a good idea to read my 'about me' before following. Only over 18s, please.

summary: Given how much JKR loves Neville and how she would never taint his heroic act of killing Nagini, what do you think is she going...
question: Given how much JKR loves Neville and how she would never taint his heroic act of killing Nagini, what do you think is she going to do with her character to make sure we won’t feel sorry for her? I’ve been trying to wrap my mind around what Nagini’s character arc is going to be but I can’t think of anything substantial. Do you have any idea about it?
answer:
Oh, man, I don’t know. I trust her as a storyteller, but I wasn’t overjoyed when we heard about Nagini’s true origin. I’m not going to stop being entirely itchy about it until we learn what really happened.  Because, yeah, it seems to throw a nasty shadow under Neville’s heroic act. 

I do believe JKR was telling the truth when she said she’s known Nagini was originally a person for twenty years, though. If you read the Godric’s Hollow chapter of Deathly Hallows it’s clear that Nagini is not just a normal snake. She speaks Parseltongue like a human, if that makes sense. So, JKR must have had this in mind when she wrote Neville’s big scene.

We know it’s not the case that Nagini became completely animal and lost all her humanity. I’m wondering if maybe being a snake was agony for her. It’s been said in interviews, I think by Claudia Kim, that Nagini desperately wants to remain human. And she was also a Horcrux, and it’s easy to imagine how horrible that would be. Maybe her will wasn’t her own. Maybe she ended up as little more than an extension of Voldemort’s mind, with her own beneath it screaming. (lalala)  So it’s possible her death will eventually look like an act of mercy. There did seem to be genuine affection between Voldemort and Nagini, but it’s possible to imagine that it was actually Voldemort’s affection for himself, reflected two ways. XD

We’ll have to see. I’m excited to find out. (I hope the resolution is satisfying.)

reblog.comment:
Oh, man, I don’t know. I trust her as a storyteller, but I wasn’t overjoyed when we heard about Nagini’s true origin. I’m not going to stop being entirely itchy about it until we learn what really happened.  Because, yeah, it seems to throw a nasty shadow under Neville’s heroic act. 

I do believe JKR was telling the truth when she said she’s known Nagini was originally a person for twenty years, though. If you read the Godric’s Hollow chapter of Deathly Hallows it’s clear that Nagini is not just a normal snake. She speaks Parseltongue like a human, if that makes sense. So, JKR must have had this in mind when she wrote Neville’s big scene.

We know it’s not the case that Nagini became completely animal and lost all her humanity. I’m wondering if maybe being a snake was agony for her. It’s been said in interviews, I think by Claudia Kim, that Nagini desperately wants to remain human. And she was also a Horcrux, and it’s easy to imagine how horrible that would be. Maybe her will wasn’t her own. Maybe she ended up as little more than an extension of Voldemort’s mind, with her own beneath it screaming. (lalala)  So it’s possible her death will eventually look like an act of mercy. There did seem to be genuine affection between Voldemort and Nagini, but it’s possible to imagine that it was actually Voldemort’s affection for himself, reflected two ways. XD

We’ll have to see. I’m excited to find out. (I hope the resolution is satisfying.)

trail.content_raw:
Oh, man, I don’t know. I trust her as a storyteller, but I wasn’t overjoyed when we heard about Nagini’s true origin. I’m not going to stop being entirely itchy about it until we learn what really happened.  Because, yeah, it seems to throw a nasty shadow under Neville’s heroic act. 

I do believe JKR was telling the truth when she said she’s known Nagini was originally a person for twenty years, though. If you read the Godric’s Hollow chapter of Deathly Hallows it’s clear that Nagini is not just a normal snake. She speaks Parseltongue like a human, if that makes sense. So, JKR must have had this in mind when she wrote Neville’s big scene.

We know it’s not the case that Nagini became completely animal and lost all her humanity. I’m wondering if maybe being a snake was agony for her. It’s been said in interviews, I think by Claudia Kim, that Nagini desperately wants to remain human. And she was also a Horcrux, and it’s easy to imagine how horrible that would be. Maybe her will wasn’t her own. Maybe she ended up as little more than an extension of Voldemort’s mind, with her own beneath it screaming. (lalala)  So it’s possible her death will eventually look like an act of mercy. There did seem to be genuine affection between Voldemort and Nagini, but it’s possible to imagine that it was actually Voldemort’s affection for himself, reflected two ways. XD

We’ll have to see. I’m excited to find out. (I hope the resolution is satisfying.)
trail.content:
Oh, man, I don’t know. I trust her as a storyteller, but I wasn’t overjoyed when we heard about Nagini’s true origin. I’m not going to stop being entirely itchy about it until we learn what really happened.  Because, yeah, it seems to throw a nasty shadow under Neville’s heroic act. 

I do believe JKR was telling the truth when she said she’s known Nagini was originally a person for twenty years, though. If you read the Godric’s Hollow chapter of Deathly Hallows it’s clear that Nagini is not just a normal snake. She speaks Parseltongue like a human, if that makes sense. So, JKR must have had this in mind when she wrote Neville’s big scene.

We know it’s not the case that Nagini became completely animal and lost all her humanity. I’m wondering if maybe being a snake was agony for her. It’s been said in interviews, I think by Claudia Kim, that Nagini desperately wants to remain human. And she was also a Horcrux, and it’s easy to imagine how horrible that would be. Maybe her will wasn’t her own. Maybe she ended up as little more than an extension of Voldemort’s mind, with her own beneath it screaming. (lalala)  So it’s possible her death will eventually look like an act of mercy. There did seem to be genuine affection between Voldemort and Nagini, but it’s possible to imagine that it was actually Voldemort’s affection for himself, reflected two ways. XD

We’ll have to see. I’m excited to find out. (I hope the resolution is satisfying.)

summary:
impermanence - reservations now open!

 imperamence is a laidback, member driven marauders era rp coming soon to jcink! we...
caption:
impermanence - reservations now open!

imperamence is a laidback, member driven marauders era rp coming soon to jcink! we feature a true shipper application that promotes good plotting, no word count, and relaxed activity rules. our aim is to foster a creative and welcoming community that allows us to write our own stories.

our discord opens friday the 19th, and the site opens sunday the 21st!

the plot ● the reservations ● the previews

blog.name: rachelundefined
blog.title: RachelUndefined
blog.description:
Who am I? Can anyone really answer that question? I don't know who I am. I'm undefined.

What am I into? My biggest, but by no means only, passion is HP fanfics. My interests are many and varied, and my posts reflect my diversity.

Will our interests correspond? Only you can answer that question. Or will you, like myself, remain undefined?

summary: Vacation 1975 Chapter 1: Prologue, a harry potter fanfic | FanFiction
title: Vacation 1975 Chapter 1: Prologue, a harry potter fanfic | FanFiction
description:
TRIGGER WARNING: Mentions of abuse

Title: Vacation 1975
Author: Janara
Fandom: Harry Potter
Tags: Timetravel; Severitus; Harry Who?

Summary: Heartbroken, Harry is sent back to the Dursleys after seeing his godfather die right before his eyes. Alone and miserable, Harry turns to the book Luna gave him. He was entitled to a vacation, right? Unfortunately, Harry had forgotten the Harry Potter factor, meaning that if anything could go wrong, it will. Or did it?

summary: Draco: Are you in love with me?  Harry: Of course, I love you! Draco: Then why do you make me go to the Weasley Burrow? That...
body:
Draco: Are you in love with me?

Harry: Of course, I love you!

Draco: Then why do you make me go to the Weasley Burrow? That doesn’t look like love to me, Harry

Inspired by rockmarina’s prompt list

title: Three Parts of a Whole
body:
by Anonymous

Ginny Weasley’s Soul Mark appears after her first meeting with Harry Potter.

But things are never simple where Harry Potter is concerned.

Words: 6684, Chapters: 3/3, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Harry Potter - J. K. Rowling
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: Multi
  • Characters: Ginny Weasley, Harry Potter, Tom Riddle | Voldemort
